meanings.definition: Excessive outward curvature of the spine, causing a hunchback appearance.
meanings.sent1: Her kyphosis made her back look hunched and curved.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed him with kyphosis due to his spine's abnormal curve.
meanings.sent3: Despite his kyphosis, he still managed to stand tall and confident.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to rest on her shoulders, bending her like kyphosis.
meanings.sent5: The kyphosis in the old tree trunk showed years of growth and struggle.

meanings.definition: The condition of having an abnormally rounded upper back.
meanings.sent1: Kyphosis can affect posture and cause discomfort in the upper back.
meanings.sent2: She sought treatment for her kyphosis to improve her spinal alignment.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about having a 'party in the back' due to his kyphosis.
meanings.sent4: Her kyphosis was like carrying a permanent backpack on her upper back.
meanings.sent5: The kyphosis in the sculpture gave it a unique and intriguing shape.
